svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
July 6, 2024" date: "2024-07-06"
Eth News and Links
Pectra upgrade size discussion (potentially cap scope)
All core devs
* All core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) #191 : Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade:
pectra-devnet-1 : now expect to launch in 1-2 weeks, locally tested with 2 execution
layer + 3 consensus layer clients EIP7702 : delegation designation proposal to be
merged & included in pectra-devnet-2 RIP7212 secp256r1 precompile : discussion on
including in Pectra, whether to use RIP precompile address & what return value to use;
review inclusion at next ACDE EIP7002 EL triggered withdrawals & EIP7251 maxEB :
agreed to add events Pectra size discussion : potentially capping (strong support) or
reducing (some support) scope Discussions: history expiry and improving blob
transaction propagation To progress non-upgrade specific features need to target
specific devnets, provide updates at all core devs & more breakouts
* Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade: pectra-devnet-1 : now expect to launch in 1-2
weeks, locally tested with 2 execution layer + 3 consensus layer clients EIP7702 :
delegation designation proposal to be merged & included in pectra-devnet-2 RIP7212
secp256r1 precompile : discussion on including in Pectra, whether to use RIP
precompile address & what return value to use; review inclusion at next ACDE EIP7002
EL triggered withdrawals & EIP7251 maxEB : agreed to add events Pectra size discussion
: potentially capping (strong support) or reducing (some support) scope
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade:
* pectra-devnet-1 : now expect to launch in 1-2 weeks, locally tested with 2 execution
layer + 3 consensus layer clients
* EIP7702 : delegation designation proposal to be merged & included in pectra-devnet-2
EIP7702 : delegation designation proposal to be merged & included in pectra-devnet-2
* RIP7212 secp256r1 precompile : discussion on including in Pectra, whether to use RIP
precompile address & what return value to use; review inclusion at next ACDE
RIP7212 secp256r1 precompile : discussion on including in Pectra, whether to use RIP
* EIP7002 EL triggered withdrawals & EIP7251 maxEB : agreed to add events
EIP7002 EL triggered withdrawals & EIP7251 maxEB : agreed to add events
* Pectra size discussion
Pectra size discussion
* Discussions: history expiry and improving blob transaction propagation To progress
non-upgrade specific features need to target specific devnets, provide updates at all
core devs & more breakouts
Discussions: history expiry and improving blob transaction propagation
* To progress non-upgrade specific features need to target specific devnets, provide
updates at all core devs & more breakouts
Osaka + F starname upgrade
* Verkle implementers call #20 : blockhash handling to use EIP4788 behavior, sync
during transition needs to be combination of snap & full sync and avoiding extra EOF
extcodesize/hash costs
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 29.2% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 29.2% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
Consensus layer: Prysm 37% Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
* Consensus layer: Prysm 37%
Consensus layer: Prysm 37%
* Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America & Europe
Layer 1
* Vitalik: faster transaction confirmation times via Single Slot Finality &
rollup/based preconfirmations
Vitalik: faster transaction confirmation times via Single Slot Finality & rollup/based
preconfirmations
* EIP7732 ePBS: ePBS breakout #4 : EIP created, pull request for consensus specs,
withdrawal processing complications and bid gossip p2p DoS vulnerability Terence: fork
choice attacks in ePBS Potuz: benefits of ePBS
EIP7732 ePBS:
* ePBS breakout #4 : EIP created, pull request for consensus specs, withdrawal
processing complications and bid gossip p2p DoS vulnerability
ePBS breakout #4 : EIP created, pull request for consensus specs, withdrawal
* Terence: fork choice attacks in ePBS
Terence: fork choice attacks in ePBS
* Potuz: benefits of ePBS
Potuz: benefits of ePBS
* Dapplion: fetch blobs from execution layer pool proposal, rather than wait for blobs
over gossipsub
Dapplion: fetch blobs from execution layer pool proposal, rather than wait for blobs
* Flashbots rbuilder : MEV-Boost block builder in Rust
Flashbots rbuilder : MEV-Boost block builder in Rust
* Gossipsub performance: bandwidth consumption and message propagation latency
Gossipsub performance: bandwidth consumption and message propagation latency
Client Releases
* Execution layer: Geth v1.14.6 : adds experimental stateless witness builder & (self)
cross validator
* Geth v1.14.6 : adds experimental stateless witness builder & (self) cross validator
For Stakers
* Obol Charon v1 : distributed validator middleware
Obol Charon v1 : distributed validator middleware
* EthStaker staking survey results : 32% genesis stakers, 74% donâ€™t work in crypto &
95% male
EthStaker staking survey results : 32% genesis stakers, 74% donâ€™t work in crypto & 95%
male
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs (Ethereum improvement proposals): EIP7732 : Enshrined proposer-builder
separation (ePBS) EIP7735 : Gas fee sponsorship EIP7736 : Leaf-level state expiry in
verkle trees
EIPs (Ethereum improvement proposals):
* EIP7732 : Enshrined proposer-builder separation (ePBS)
EIP7732 : Enshrined proposer-builder separation (ePBS)
* EIP7735 : Gas fee sponsorship
EIP7735 : Gas fee sponsorship
* EIP7736 : Leaf-level state expiry in verkle trees
EIP7736 : Leaf-level state expiry in verkle trees
* ERCs (application layer standards): ERC7731 : Vulnerability and exposure identifier
ERC7734 : Decentralized identity verification (DID)
ERCs (application layer standards):
* ERC7731 : Vulnerability and exposure identifier
ERC7731 : Vulnerability and exposure identifier
* ERC7734 : Decentralized identity verification (DID)
Stuff for developers
* Foundry forge-std v1.9.0 : adds cheatcodes for a uint prompt, generate a random
address/uint, invariant excludeSelector helper and deprecates console2; v1.9.1 : adds
missing console logs
Foundry forge-std v1.9.0 : adds cheatcodes for a uint prompt, generate a random
* EVMRepl (formerly Gas Playground): adds Solidity compilation errors
EVMRepl (formerly Gas Playground): adds Solidity compilation errors
* Wevm webauthn-p256 (TypeScript): P256 signature utilities for WebAuthn
Wevm webauthn-p256 (TypeScript): P256 signature utilities for WebAuthn
* Stealth Address SDK v1 beta (TypeScript): work with EIP5564 & EIP6538 stealth
addresses
Stealth Address SDK v1 beta (TypeScript): work with EIP5564 & EIP6538 stealth
Security
* Immunefi Safe Harbor : implementation of Security Alliance (SEAL) whitehat safe
harbor framework
Enterprise
* Societe Generale-FORGE EURCV stablecoin no longer permissioned to use
Job Listings
* Aragon: Senior Smart Contract Developer
Aragon: Senior Smart Contract Developer
* Privacy and Scaling Explorations: ZK Circuits Engineer
Privacy and Scaling Explorations: ZK Circuits Engineer
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
* Fees (via ultrasound.money ): Gas: 1.1 to 73.4 gwei, 5.5 gwei average; zero net
issuance at 23.8 gwei 14k ETH net issuance this week
Fees (via ultrasound.money ):
* Gas: 1.1 to 73.4 gwei, 5.5 gwei average; zero net issuance at 23.8 gwei
Gas: 1.1 to 73.4 gwei, 5.5 gwei average; zero net issuance at 23.8 gwei
* 14k ETH net issuance this week
14k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $2,831 - $3,512, currently $2,990, all time high $4,878
ETHUSD : $2,831 - $3,512, currently $2,990, all time high $4,878
* ETHBTC : currently 0.053 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.053 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* Element DAOâ€™s Hyperdrive (fixed/variable rate 6 month yields) live on mainnet
Element DAOâ€™s Hyperdrive (fixed/variable rate 6 month yields) live on mainnet
* Moshicam (onchain Instagram): mint photos with custom borders on Base
Moshicam (onchain Instagram): mint photos with custom borders on Base
* WannaBet : peer-to-peer betting, onchain escrow, designated judge
WannaBet : peer-to-peer betting, onchain escrow, designated judge
Regulation/business/tokens
* Judge dismissed SEC claim that secondary BNB sales are securities, in case against
Binance
Judge dismissed SEC claim that secondary BNB sales are securities, in case against
* Circle USDC/EURC stablecoins EU MiCA compliant with reserves held in Europe
Circle USDC/EURC stablecoins EU MiCA compliant with reserves held in Europe
* Logan Paul sues Coffeezilla for defamation over CryptoZoo reporting
Logan Paul sues Coffeezilla for defamation over CryptoZoo reporting
* German government moved 2k BTC & Mt Gox moved 47k BTC
German government moved 2k BTC & Mt Gox moved 47k BTC
General
* EF updates mailing list compromised to email link to crypto drainer
EF updates mailing list compromised to email link to crypto drainer
* Twilio: Authy account data (including phone numbers) identified via unauthenticated
endpoint
Twilio: Authy account data (including phone numbers) identified via unauthenticated
* regreSSHion : OpenSSH server remote code execution vulnerability
regreSSHion : OpenSSH server remote code execution vulnerability
END OF SERVICE: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
Editor: @abcoathup Follow @WeekinEthNews for the most clicked links Permalink:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-july-6-2024
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Jul 7 â€“ Devcon scholars program deadline
Jul 7 â€“ Devcon scholars program deadline

Jul 29-30 â€“ EDCON Tokyo conference
